alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 1:19AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Cherokee and Clay. Portions of east Tennessee, including the following county, Monroe. * WHEN...Until 330 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 219 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Murphy, Unaka, Citico and Brasstown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
